results.title: A Race against people: the story of Hong Kong's re-housing programme
results.creator_credit: British Information Services and Hong Kong Film Unit
results.brief_description: The story of Hong Kong’s Re-housing Program. The re-settlement of new migrants and other Chinese members of the community in to high-rise housing provided by the authorities at public expense. Commentary by Eamonn Andrews.

results.title: A Question of attitude
results.creator_credit: Stuart Glover, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Discusses the problem of finding work for physically handicapped people, showing many examples of successful workers in varied skilled positions. Argues that employers’ reluctance to make positions available is the main difficulty.

results.title: A Queen who returned [short version]
results.brief_description: An account of the Queen Mother’s visit to Melbourne and the city’s festivities held for the event. Freatures footage of the Queen Mother at Flinder Street Station, the Exhibition Building, State Swimming Centre and her meeting with some Melbourne dignatories.

results.title: A Queen who returned
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey, David Swift and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: On the 27th of February, Queen Elizabeth, the Queen Mother, arrived at Essendon for a five day visit to Victoria. This film follows Her Majesty through many official functions during her visit including the State Reception, the Queen Elizabeth Stakes at Flemington, the children’s display at the Melbourne Cricket Ground and the memorable State Ball at the Melbourne Town Hall. As an introduction to the film, and as a background to this Royal Visit, we see the City of Melbourne - the old city of the past; the exciting new city of the future; its people and their preparations for the Royal Tour.

results.title: A Quarter million teenagers
results.creator_credit: Robert Churchill, County Health Department and Los Angeles City School
results.brief_description: Present physiological aspects of venereal disease. Discusses gonorrhea and syphilis indetail, explaining how the organisms enter the body, how the diseases affect tissues and organs, and how they may be recognised. Eplains that the diseases can be cured emphasizing the need for early treatment.

results.title: A Prison film: still living
results.brief_description: An open-ended film which examines life inside a women’s prison. The women in the institution are still very much alive and therefore still grappling with the same human concerns as the rest of us - except that incarceration serves to heighten those problems. Individual inmates and staff members of the prison express their attitudes, concerns, doubts and hopes.

results.title: A Priceless day = Ajandek ez a nap [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Peter Gothar, Budapest Filmstudio, Hungarofilm and Magyar Film
results.brief_description: Adapted from a short story by Peter Zimre, “A Priceless day” is a quirky drama which centres around several characters whose lives are interwoven for various reasons, but not always the right reasons. Iren Zemann (Cecilia Esztergalyos) is a thirty something kindergarten teacher who is forced to move from her apartment when her elderly landlady dies. At the same time she is also mistress to Attila (Pal Hetenyi), a married man with children who has just told his wife Anna (Judit Pogany) about his affair with Iren. Attila, through his friend Hevesi, decides to find Iren a new apartment but all manner of complications ensue as Hevesi becomes involved in some rather underhanded dealings in securing Iren her new apartment, including a forced marriage in name only to Gabi (Janos Derzsi), a much younger single man, who would very much like to take advantage of his situation with Iren. An eventual meeting between Iren and Attila’s wife Anna provides a resulting ironic twist to the story. Set in 1970s Hungary, this is quite a poignant story reflecting the bleakness and the bureaucracy of the times. (Awards: Winner of the Golden Lion Award, Venice Film Festival, 1980)

results.title: A Potter's world
results.brief_description: The craftsmanship of Bernard Leach who, after a number of years in the East, established a pottery in Cornwall. The influence of the Orient on his work is indicated.
